title: Software Developer 3
description:
**Job Description**
 Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) can provide you the opportunity to lead a team that builds and operates a suite of massive scale, integrated cloud services in a broadly distributed, multi\\-tenant cloud environment. OCI is committed to providing the best in cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the world‚Äôs biggest challenges.
   

  

 We‚Äôre looking for Engineers with expertise and passion in solving difficult problems in distributed systems and highly available services. If this is you, at Oracle you can help, shape, design, build, and run innovative new systems from the ground up. These are exciting times in our space \\- we are growing fast and working on ambitious new initiatives.
   

  

 What is OCI Developer and Observability Products team?
   

  

 The OCI Developer and Observability Products Group is constructing a robust suite of products aimed at supporting and enhancing the developer experience and monitoring and operational capabilities of OCI services. This group provides a comprehensive set of tools and technologies to ensure efficient and effective management of OCI's operations.
   

  

 By developing these products, the group aims to empower OCI services with the necessary resources to excel in their operational roles, ultimately contributing to the overall success and reliability of OCI's offerings. This initiative is a strategic step towards strengthening OCI's position in the market by prioritizing service performance and customer satisfaction.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Senior Engineer, you will contribute to the design and development of key components within Oracle‚Äôs Cloud Infrastructure. You should be capable of specifying, designing, and implementing enhancements to existing software architectures in response to evolving requirements. A strong ability to dive deep into all layers of the technology stack, including low\\-level systems, is essential. In addition, you will provide technical leadership and mentorship to other software engineers on the team.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Career Level \\- IC3
   

  

**About Us**
 Only Oracle brings together the data, infrastructure, applications, and expertise to power everything from industry innovations to life\\-saving care. And with AI embedded across our products and services, we help customers turn that promise into a better future for all. Discover your potential at a company leading the way in AI and cloud solutions that impact billions of lives.
   

  

 True innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to growing a workforce that promotes opportunities for all with competitive benefits that support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We‚Äôre committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation\\-request\\_mb@oracle.com or by calling 1\\-888\\-404\\-2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans‚Äô status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Backend Developer Internship
description:
**Job Overview:** 




 We are looking for a Zero\\-Level Backend Developer who is eager to start a career in backend development using Node.js. This role is ideal for students or fresh graduates with basic JavaScript knowledge who want hands\\-on industry experience.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Assist in building and maintaining backend applications
* Develop simple REST APIs
* Work with databases and server logic
* Debug and fix basic issues in code
* Collaborate with frontend developers
* Follow coding standards and best practices
* Continuously learn new backend technologies



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Basic JavaScript
* Basic knowledge of Node.js
* Understanding of APIs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
* Basic Database Knowledge (MongoDB / MySQL)
* Git \\& GitHub basics
* Logical thinking and problem\\-solving



  





**Preferred (Optional):** 



* Knowledge of Express.js
* Small personal or college projects
* Basic authentication knowledge (JWT / Sessions)



  





**Education:** 




 BCA / MCA / B.Tech / Diploma / Any Computer\\-Related Field
 



 Final\\-Year Students Can Apply
 



  





**Soft Skills:** 



* Communication skills
* Team collaboration
* Willingness to learn
* Time management



  





**Benefits:** 



* Real\\-world project experience
* Mentorship from senior developers
* Internship Certificate / Recommendation Letter
* Career growth opportunities

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun \\- leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation \\- for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we‚Äôll give you what you need to make it happen. It won‚Äôt always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you‚Äôll never run alone. Run what runs the world.
   

  

 This Position reports to:
   

  

 R\\&D Team Lead
   

  

  

  

  

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to successful project results in technology, software, product, and/or solution development, as well as associated Intellectual Proper\\-ty (IP). Each day, you will act as the first point of contact in Research and Development for specific product\\-related issues and maintenance. You will also showcase your expertise by identifying, proposing, and implementing innovative solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you‚Äôll help run what runs the world, by taking on meaningful work that drives real impact.
   

  

 The work model for the role is:
   

  

 This role is contributing to the Electrification business in Smart Power at Bangalore, India.
   

  

**You will be mainly accountable for**
* Required active participation/contribution in team discussions.
* Provide technical solutions to in solving business problems.
* Collaborate with the team to understand business needs and requirements.
* Write clean and efficient code to ensure the quality and performance of the software.
* Perform unit testing and debugging of applications. Provide technical guidance and support to junior developers.


**Our Team Dynamics**
 Our teams support each other, collaborate, and never stop learning. Everyone brings something unique, and together we push ideas forward to solve real problems. Being part of our team means your work matters \\- because the progress we make here creates real impact out there.
   

  

  

**Qualifications For The Role**
* You are immersed in R\\&D function for software development
* You have 7 to 12 years of experience in design, build and configure applications to meet business pro\\-cess and application requirements using Angular, Spring Boot, RESTful API development, Micro services and SQL
* Possess an enhanced knowledge of Angular, Spring Boot
* Degree in Computer Science (should be full\\-time)
* You are at ease communicating in English


**More About Us**
 ABB Smart Power is a global technology leader, with products and solutions that make power supplies smart, connected and protected. Its intelligent products and solutions make power more competitive by improving the energy efficiency, productivity and reliability of almost any operation.
   

  

 \\#ABBCareers \\#RunwithABB \\#Runwhatrunstheworld
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.
   

  

**Fraud Warning:** 
 Any genuine offer from ABB will always be preceded by a formal application and interview process.
   

  

 We never ask for money from job applicants.
   

  

 For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply.
   

  

 Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how\\-to\\-apply/fraud\\-warning.

title: Java Springboot & Microservices
description:

title: Engineering Lead - Healthcare Technology
description:
**Job Title: Engineering Lead \\- Healthcare Technology** 




  





**Location** 
 : Pune, India
 



  





**About Us:** 





 We are a cutting\\-edge healthcare technology company dedicated to revolutionizing the healthcare industry through innovation and advanced technology solutions. Our mission is to provide seamless, efficient, and patient\\-centric healthcare experiences by leveraging the latest advancements in software engineering.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As a Senior Engineering Lead, you will play a pivotal role in driving the development and evolution of our healthcare technology platform. You will lead a talented team of engineers and collaborate closely with cross\\-functional teams to deliver high\\-quality, scalable, and reliable solutions that meet the needs of our users and the healthcare industry. Your expertise in Node.js, React, Express, GraphQL, Postgres, Prisma, Python, AWS, Kubernetes, Typescript, Monitoring, and Observability will be instrumental in shaping the future of our platform.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead and mentor a team of engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence.
* Architect, design, and develop robust, scalable, and high\\-performance backend and frontend solutions using Node.js, React, Express, GraphQL, and other relevant technologies.
* Drive the adoption of best practices in software development, including code reviews, automated testing, continuous integration, and deployment.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and stakeholders to define and prioritize features, enhancements, and technical requirements.
* Ensure the security, reliability, and performance of the platform, implementing monitoring, alerting, and observability solutions.
* Design and optimize database schemas, queries, and performance tuning for Postgres and other databases.
* Implement and manage infrastructure as code using AWS services and Kubernetes.
* Leverage Typescript for type\\-safe and maintainable codebase.
* Utilize advanced monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, and ELK stack for proactive issue detection and resolution.
* Explore and evaluate emerging technologies and tools to enhance the platform's capabilities and performance.



  





**Required Skills and Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* 7\\+ years of professional experience in software engineering, with a focus on backend and frontend development.
* Extensive hands\\-on experience with Node.js, React, Express, GraphQL, and Postgres.
* Strong proficiency in Prisma, Python, AWS, Kubernetes, and Typescript.
* In\\-depth knowledge of monitoring and observability best practices and tools.
* Experience with Golang, SQL, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, and GRPC is a plus.
* Familiarity with messaging frameworks such as RabbitMQ and Kafka.
* Prior experience in healthcare technology or related domains is highly desirable.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross\\-functional teams.



  





**Extras:** 



* Familiarity with healthcare standards and protocols such as FHIR and HL7\\.
* Experience with additional technologies like Power BI, further enhancing analytics capabilities.
* Join us in our mission to revolutionize healthcare through technology and make a significant impact on the lives of millions. If you are passionate about leveraging your expertise to drive meaningful change, we want to hear from you!

title: Security Software Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200\\+ colleagues in 75\\+ countries and very few office\\-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder\\-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 Canonical is looking for exceptional security\\-focused software engineers to be integrated across product teams. While they also contribute to the product as engineers, their primary focus is to challenge the entire team to think more deeply about security through state\\-of\\-the\\-art practices such as threat modeling, table\\-top exercises, architecture and design reviews, static analysis tools, and fuzzing, among others.
   

  

 These roles encompass all aspects of product security, including feature development, vulnerability response, proactive security, and open source community participation. Engineers in these roles collaborate closely with other Canonical teams, customers, and partners across the open source ecosystem.
   

  

 Each product engineering team at Canonical reserves one or two openings for security\\-oriented software engineers. We also develop a number of products driven entirely by security needs, such as our AppArmor kernel investments and the Ubuntu Security Guide (USG). As the publisher of Ubuntu, we also handle long\\-term security response for the entire operating system and open source ecosystem. Working with tens of thousands of upstreams means that we need to be fluent in every major programming language and design, build, and adopt sophisticated tools that enable us to work at scale and speed with confidence.
   

  

 Apply here if you are an exceptional security\\-focused software engineer, passionate about open source, and excited by Canonical's products and mission.
   

  

 This role requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through strong self\\-discipline and motivation. It also involves mandatory international travel at least twice a year, typically for one week.
   

  

 Location: Worldwide, this is a globally remote role
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

 Security roles might tackle any of the following:
   

  

* Define, implement, and document new security features
* Lead security\\-focused initiatives within a product engineering team
* Analyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in open source software
* Contribute to Ubuntu and upstream open source projects to benefit the community
* Audit and analyze source code for vulnerabilities
* Integrate new tools into our security infrastructure, pipelines, and processes
* Achieve and retain various security certifications
* Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components to meet country\\-specific compliance requirements, such as FIPS and Common Criteria (CC) certifications
* Work with external partners to develop Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmarks
* Design and develop hardening automation for Ubuntu
* Stay up to date with trends and developments in the security industry
* Develop, test, and maintain new software capabilities
* Provide guidance and support to other engineering teams on security best practices


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* A track record of going above and beyond expectations
* Thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and how to fix them
* Knowledge of modern software engineering techniques
* Familiarity with open source development tools and methodologies
* Skill in one or more of C, C\\+\\+, Python, Go, Rust, Java, Ruby, PHP, or JavaScript/Typescript
* Experience as a security champion
* Experience driving security within a wider SSDLC process
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self\\-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Results\\-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments


 Optional skills we also value
   

  

* Clear and effective communication with both the team and Ubuntu community members
* Experience working with the Linux kernel
* Experience with security certifications and knowledge of FIPS and/or Common Criteria (CC)
* Experience with OVAL (Open Vulnerability Assessment Language)
* Knowledge of cryptographic modules such as OpenSSL and Libgcrypt
* Knowledge of low\\-level Linux cryptography APIs
* Demonstrated ability to learn quickly
* Performance engineering experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance\\-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice\\-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence \\- in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote\\-first company since its inception in 2004\\. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Quality Assurance Specialist
description:
**We‚Äôre Hiring: Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer** 




 üìç
 **Company Location:** 
 Hiranandani Estate, Thane, Maharashtra
 



 üïí
 **Work Timings:** 
 12 PM ‚Äì 8 PM IST
 



 üë©‚Äçüíª
 **Experience:** 
 1‚Äì5 years
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We‚Äôre looking for a detail\\-oriented
 **QA Engineer** 
 to ensure the quality, performance, and usability of our software applications. You‚Äôll work closely with development teams in a fast\\-paced, agile environment.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Test applications for functionality, performance, and usability
* Identify, document, and track bugs/defects
* Perform functional, regression, and UAT testing
* Collaborate with developers to resolve issues
* Ensure product quality meets requirements



**Requirements:** 



* Knowledge of software testing (Manual/Automation)
* Experience with functional, regression \\& UAT testing
* Familiarity with
 **Asana**
* Basic understanding of web/mobile applications
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills



**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience with web\\-based or SaaS applications
* Good communication and documentation skills
* Quality\\-focused mindset and eagerness to learn



  





**About EAX Media** 




 EAX Media is a US\\-based, data\\-driven digital marketing and growth agency headquartered in Virginia. We help businesses make smarter marketing decisions using analytics, performance tracking, and strategic insights. Our focus is on delivering measurable results, improving ROI, and building scalable marketing systems for clients across multiple industries.
 



  





 Company website\\-https://eaxmedia.com/

Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200\\+ colleagues in 75\\+ countries and very few office\\-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder\\-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 Canonical is looking for exceptional security\\-focused software engineers to be integrated across product teams. While they also contribute to the product as engineers, their primary focus is to challenge the entire team to think more deeply about security through state\\-of\\-the\\-art practices such as threat modeling, table\\-top exercises, architecture and design reviews, static analysis tools, and fuzzing, among others.
   

  

 These roles encompass all aspects of product security, including feature development, vulnerability response, proactive security, and open source community participation. Engineers in these roles collaborate closely with other Canonical teams, customers, and partners across the open source ecosystem.
   

  

 Each product engineering team at Canonical reserves one or two openings for security\\-oriented software engineers. We also develop a number of products driven entirely by security needs, such as our AppArmor kernel investments and the Ubuntu Security Guide (USG). As the publisher of Ubuntu, we also handle long\\-term security response for the entire operating system and open source ecosystem. Working with tens of thousands of upstreams means that we need to be fluent in every major programming language and design, build, and adopt sophisticated tools that enable us to work at scale and speed with confidence.
   

  

 Apply here if you are an exceptional security\\-focused software engineer, passionate about open source, and excited by Canonical's products and mission.
   

  

 This role requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through strong self\\-discipline and motivation. It also involves mandatory international travel at least twice a year, typically for one week.
   

  

 Location: Worldwide, this is a globally remote role
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

 Security roles might tackle any of the following:
   

  

* Define, implement, and document new security features
* Lead security\\-focused initiatives within a product engineering team
* Analyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in open source software
* Contribute to Ubuntu and upstream open source projects to benefit the community
* Audit and analyze source code for vulnerabilities
* Integrate new tools into our security infrastructure, pipelines, and processes
* Achieve and retain various security certifications
* Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components to meet country\\-specific compliance requirements, such as FIPS and Common Criteria (CC) certifications
* Work with external partners to develop Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmarks
* Design and develop hardening automation for Ubuntu
* Stay up to date with trends and developments in the security industry
* Develop, test, and maintain new software capabilities
* Provide guidance and support to other engineering teams on security best practices


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* A track record of going above and beyond expectations
* Thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and how to fix them
* Knowledge of modern software engineering techniques
* Familiarity with open source development tools and methodologies
* Skill in one or more of C, C\\+\\+, Python, Go, Rust, Java, Ruby, PHP, or JavaScript/Typescript
* Experience as a security champion
* Experience driving security within a wider SSDLC process
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self\\-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Results\\-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments


 Optional skills we also value
   

  

* Clear and effective communication with both the team and Ubuntu community members
* Experience working with the Linux kernel
* Experience with security certifications and knowledge of FIPS and/or Common Criteria (CC)
* Experience with OVAL (Open Vulnerability Assessment Language)
* Knowledge of cryptographic modules such as OpenSSL and Libgcrypt
* Knowledge of low\\-level Linux cryptography APIs
* Demonstrated ability to learn quickly
* Performance engineering experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance\\-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice\\-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence \\- in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote\\-first company since its inception in 2004\\. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Estimation Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 








 Synergy Group is a certified ISO\\-9001\\-2015 and ISO 45001\\-2018 technical resource company specializing in Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) solutions. With expertise in bulk material handling systems, pollution control systems, heavy engineering solutions, and plant optimizations, Synergy Group serves industries such as cement, steel, ceramics, aluminum, mining, and other process sectors. The company also offers EPC plant construction with automation and PC\\-based SCADA operations, turning concepts into reality. Supported by advanced engineering software and a 95\\+ member strong engineering office in India, Synergy Group delivers innovative, efficient, and reliable solutions for enhanced profitability and data\\-driven processes.
 



  





**Role Description** 








 This is a full\\-time, on\\-site position based in Chalakkudy, for an Estimation Engineer. Key responsibilities include preparing Bill of Quantities (BOQ), conducting project cost estimations, providing support for civil engineering projects, and engaging in supplier and vendor negotiations. The role also involves conducting thorough research and analysis to ensure accurate project estimations and cost control measures.
 



  





**Qualifications** 







* Proficient in preparing Bill of Quantities (BOQ) and executing accurate Project Estimation tasks.
* Solid foundation in Civil Engineering concepts and their application in industrial projects.
* Strong Negotiation skills with suppliers, vendors, and other stakeholders.
* Skilled in conducting detailed Research to support estimation and project management activities.
* Proficiency in project management tools and engineering\\-related software is an advantage.
* Exceptional problem\\-solving abilities and organizational skills.
* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field is preferred.
* Previous experience in estimation or EPC projects will be a significant advantage.

title: flutter moblie app intern
description:
**Company Description**

 ASAN Innovators specializes in providing affordable, high\\-quality AI\\-driven solutions, including intelligent chatbots, automation systems, mobile applications, and custom platforms tailored for businesses of all sizes. As a Startup India, MSME, and ISO\\-certified AI company, ASAN Innovators strives to democratize access to AI and emerging technologies to empower startups, students, and enterprises worldwide. The company's mission is to offer innovative, budget\\-friendly tools that enable growth, digital transformation, and scalability without compromising quality. With a commitment to innovation, ASAN Innovators delivers cutting\\-edge solutions that address real\\-world challenges and foster long\\-term impact.
   




**Role Description**

 This is a full\\-time remote internship for a Flutter Mobile App Intern. The intern will be responsible for assisting in the development of mobile applications using Flutter, writing clean and reusable code, debugging and testing applications, and collaborating with the development team on various tasks. Additional responsibilities include staying updated on industry trends, implementing best practices, and contributing to the design and development of user\\-friendly mobile apps.
   




**Qualifications**
* Experience with Flutter, Dart, and cross\\-platform mobile app development
* Understanding of UI/UX design principles, responsive design, and Material Design
* Proficiency in debugging, testing, and problem\\-solving skills for mobile development
* Strong knowledge of mobile app lifecycle and state management
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs, backend integration, and database management
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of a remote development team
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* Enthusiasm for learning and applying emerging technologies to real\\-world projects
* Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

title: SDE Intern
description:
**Company Description** 




 Oviqo is revolutionizing education by building the world's first Learning Operating System, designed to make learning predictive and personalized. Focused on live teaching and tailored educational experiences, Oviqo combines innovation and technology to provide a dynamic platform for learners. By merging personalization and software\\-driven solutions, Oviqo aims to redefine how education is delivered and experienced.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a full\\-time on\\-site role for a Software Development Engineer (SDE) Intern based in Pune. The SDE Intern will assist in designing, developing, and optimizing software solutions. Primary responsibilities include contributing to back\\-end web development tasks, programming, debugging, and implementing software enhancements. The role will also involve collaborating with the technical team to solve problems and improve system functionality.
 



 Stipend:15,000 pm
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Strong foundation in Computer Science concepts
* Proficiency in Back\\-End Web Development and Software Development
* Hands\\-on experience in Programming and Object\\-Oriented Programming (OOP)
* Ability to work collaboratively with a team and solve problems effectively
* Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science or a related field
